56b0ccf8-3e9f-4ccf-b2fa-93c73a40346f.description:
[h1] Please read! [/h1]

Below is a guide on how to use this mod, it is not as simple as adding it to your world and giving things the ability to spawn in with invalid joints (although that would be quite nice).

[h1]How to find your blueprint file[/h1]

First of all you need to locate the blueprint file you wish to fix, if the blueprint is stored on your lift, do the following: Go to [b]C:\Users\<Your User>\AppData\Roaming\Axolot Games\Scrap Mechanic\User\User_<SteamID>\Blueprints[/b], this is where all your blueprints are stored. Next, you need to search for the correct folder that your blueprint file is located in, my personal method is using the search feature in a text editor like VSCode, but you can also search based on time updated etc. Once you have found the correct folder for your blueprint, go into that folder and copy the 'blueprint.json' file, this is the file you are going to put into the mod.

[h1]How to move the file to the mod[/h1]

Once you have your blueprint file, you will need to locate this mod's local files. Make sure you have subscribed the mod and go to [b]<Your steam folder directory>\Steam\steamapps\workshop\content\387990\3415417597[/b]. You will then see a folder called 'Put Your Blueprint File In Here!'. Do as it says and put the blueprint.json file inside that folder.

[h1]How to spawn in your build[/h1]

Load up a world and type the command '/fix' followed by the name of the file you put inside the mods folder, if you haven't changed its name it should just be 'blueprint.json', so the command would be '/fix blueprint.json'. Your game may freeze for a second or two as the tool is iterating through the blueprints data, your wait time depends on how big of a build it is. Once your wait time is over your creation should spawn in the direction you are looking!

If your creation is stuck in mid-air, try to locate the logic gates that are placed nearby and delete all of them, they are supposed to get deleted to un-stick the creation, but if its large, they don't get deleted.


Any bugs or suggestions feel free to let me know, and ill deal with it as fast as I can.

A like and favourite would also be greatly appreciated!

Hope you guys enjoy.
56b0ccf8-3e9f-4ccf-b2fa-93c73a40346f.name: Invalid Joint Position Fixer

570da70f-dd89-4dbe-abf1-0656ff9f6195.description:
[h1]Expands Lights with more features![/h1]
Twice the light strength, a light range setting, a default state setting, and the ability to paint the light and it's bulb separately!

[hr][/hr] 
[h2]Important![/h2]
[list]
[*]This mod offers you the option of having the [b]modded lights override the vanilla lights[/b], making it so your builds have the extra features by default, and the option of having the [b]modded lights  as their own, separate parts[/b], meaning that they will not apply to your past builds.
[*][b]By default, the modded lights are unique, and do not override vanilla lights.[/b]
[*]This setting can be toggled in-game, using the [b]/toggleLightsOverride[/b] chat command. You will need to [b]re-enter the world[/b] for the change to take effect.
[*]The [b]drawback of the override option[/b] is that, due to how Scrap Mechanic handles overriden parts, [b]lights already placed in the world will be broken[/b]. They can be fixed by simply picking them up and putting them back down, but in warehouses for example, you wont be able to do that(since they are build protected).

[*][b]If you and the person you're joining in multiplayer don't have the same override setting, funky things will start happening. You will see a warning in the chat when this happens.[/b]
[*][b]If an override mismatch does occur, just type /toggleLightsOverride in the chat, and re-join the game. After that, there should be no mismatch.[/b]
[*](Yes, I know, this is kinda annoying, but the game doesn't allow you to refresh a client's part collection on the fly)
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Features[/h2]
[list]
[*]Applies to all lights:
[list]
[*]An [b]extra 15 strength settings[/b], going from a maximum of 10 to [b]25[/b]. This allows you to make much brighter lights
[*]Setting whether the light should be on or off by default
[*]The ability to paint the light and its emitted light colour separately
[*]Connecting a [b]Color Block[/b] from [b]The Modpack[/b] will set the light's bulb colour
[/list]
[*]Only applies to some lights:
[list]
[*]A maximum range setting, allowing you to make lights that reach really far away
[/list]
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Have fun![/h2]
570da70f-dd89-4dbe-abf1-0656ff9f6195.name: Lights++

91717b52-6975-4ee2-8df7-ed2928c6fd93.description:
[h1] Blue Totebot Character [/h1]

This mod adds Blue Totebot character to the game, they spawn near GlowGorps in water or in creative with capsules


[h1] FEATURES:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Can be placed as capsule in creative mode
[*] They spawn around GlowGorps in water in Survival mode
[*] Custom character model with new sets of anims ( spinning saw on head and opening mouth when attacking )
[*] They do not take a part in raids
[*] They learn which objects are dangerous a.k.a once they touch a saw blade, they will avoid it in the future
[*] It also adds Farmbot drill head as an object in creative
[*] Blue totebots are able to change swimming height, it adds new danger to water world
[/list]
[h1] How to use it: [/h1] 

FOR CREATIVE:
[b]1. Open: SM game/Data/Character/charactersets.json under "characterSetList": line add:[/b]
[code]
"$CONTENT_91717b52-6975-4ee2-8df7-ed2928c6fd93/Character/BlueTotebot/totebot_blue.json",
[/code]

[b]Done[/b]

Now place a Blue Totebot capsule from Mods tab and hit it with a sledgehammer


FOR SURVIVAL:
[b]1. Open: SM game/Survival/Character/charactersets.json under "characterSetList": line  add:[/b]
[code]
"$CONTENT_91717b52-6975-4ee2-8df7-ed2928c6fd93/Character/BlueTotebot/totebot_blue.json",
[/code]

[b]2. Open SM game/Survival/Scripts/game/survival_spawns.lua and search for:[/b]
[code]elseif tag == "GLOWGORP" then[/code]
[b]3. Under it, add this line:[/b]
[code]
if math.random(1,2) == 1 then sm.unit.createUnit(sm.uuid.new("1a49ff17-6972-4381-ad6e-ff3fd53e321c"), sm.vec3.new(node.position.x,node.position.y,-2.2),toYaw( node.rotation ) ) end
[/code]

[b]Done[/b]

Use /spawn 1a49ff17-6972-4381-ad6e-ff3fd53e321c if you want to just spawn it in survival mode
91717b52-6975-4ee2-8df7-ed2928c6fd93.name: Blue Totebot Character

f4ddfd83-45d9-4acc-8cac-f184ce0d0801.description:
this is a blank mod for you to copy to add your own recipes for questionable marks recipe loader for use in "Fant mod", "Crashlander", "Modded Craftbot recipes" and other custom games that have support for it.

to make your own recipe mod, hit the subscribe button on this and copy the "CraftingRecipes" and "Objects" folder from this mod to a freshly made mod made with the SM mod tool through steam

this mods contents are located here:
steamapps\workshop\content\387990\3419904337
(not a file path you can fully copy and paste)


the freshly created mod would be located in your mods folder in appdata:
%appdata%\Axolot Games\Scrap Mechanic\User
(this path you can copy and paste, its not a direct path though so you will have to go)

you will also need the list of UUID's the game uses to identify items to make recipes located here:
steamapps\common\Scrap Mechanic\Survival\Gui\Language\English


for the fant mod (in this example) or any other custom game
(depending on workshop item ID) it would be located here:
steamapps\workshop\content\387990\2820096455\Gui\Language\English

the workshop ID of a mod is the second set of numbers, or the numbers in the link to the workshop page


now that you have your own mod, youre ready to start adding your own recipes and cost for items, open the InventoryDescriptions.json from the vanilla game/custom game and Craftbot.json from the copied folder in your prefered text editor (i recommend notepad++)

then use CTRL + F to search up items from the InventoryDescriptions.json by using names shown in game and copy the UUID of the item you want to craft/use in the recipe and replace the "UUID here" text in the craftbot.json file you copied (leave the quotation marks)

example UUID used by the game for scrap stone:
02ee2a98-bd8d-4a09-bb69-38edaf66b8e1
f4ddfd83-45d9-4acc-8cac-f184ce0d0801.name: Linus Blank Recipe mod

a2190361-9ec2-495b-942f-3636d6f8770c.description:
[b] Warning: Do not use in an existing world - your creations will literally fall apart!! [/b]

This mod adds a form of 'decay' to all your creations - this means that, over time, all your creations will slowly lose random bits and pieces and physically fall apart, until all that's left is a pile of random components that used to make up said creation.

Notes:
- The behavior, speed and impact of the decay greatly depends on the creation - some will last for several minutes while others may begin falling apart after just a couple seconds!

- Decay is a slow, random process. If nothing seems to be happening at first, give it a minute to get going.

- Use Physics 1 for best experience (lots of loose components falling around)

- For obvious reasons, do not use in existing or important worlds. Your stuff will fall apart!

- Big thanks to DanzenPlays for helping me figure out the block placement code!
a2190361-9ec2-495b-942f-3636d6f8770c.name: Decay

958e353c-5ab6-4bab-93ec-267c71a37c83.description:
Elektronika 7 clock for Scrap Mechanic

My discord server: https://discord.gg/5VHmpTrd7V

You can use numeric input (for example a counter from modpack) to change the digits. 0 is display off, 1 is 0, 2 is 1, etc.
You can use this awesome creation by AllieCat https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1945268106 and add math blocks which add 1 to the output of the clock (the digits, HH:MM:SS) but only for HH:MM because the clock doesnt have seconds display. Then you can just connect the math blocks to the clock. You can build a circuit that flashes the dot on the bottom.
958e353c-5ab6-4bab-93ec-267c71a37c83.name: Elektronika 7

e918d31f-78d5-4b77-98be-1d35980ab015.description:
This mod adds a gun which instantly disassembles any creation it's fired at, causing it to fall apart into all its separate bits and pieces!

The gun supports 2 modes:
- 'Slow' mode: Applies one "tick" of damage for every shot fired. Loosens random pieces in the creation.
- 'Instant' mode: Instantly loosens every single piece of the creation, including individual blocks, causing it to fall apart entirely.

Notes:
- Best used on physics 1 due to large amounts of loose objects being created.

- Using "Instant mode" on very large creations (over ~60k blocks+parts total) can cause a game crash. I cannot fix this, as the game just cannot handle that many loose parts flying around.

- Thanks to Vajdani for letting me use his Laser Tool mod's gun model and animations!
e918d31f-78d5-4b77-98be-1d35980ab015.name: Disassembler

7c5ae4d6-a818-49fc-9240-dca677c59368.description:
[b]If you think that sitting on a bare rocket thruster and turning it on is a good idea, then this mod is just for you![/b]

This mod adds the [b]Thrust-R Ridable Rocket Thruster[/b] - [i]just hop on and take off[/i]!
With this thruster, you can take flight faster than ever before!

[b]Note[/b]: The steering control is not perfectly stable at all times and can take a minute to get used to.

[h1][b] Features [/b][/h1]
[list]
    [*] [h3][b]A ridable rocket thruster![/b][/h3]
    [*] [h3][b]Automatic Launching![/b][/h3]
        No need for complicated launch sequences, just hop on and off you go!
    [*] [h3][b]Automatic Ground Avoidance![/b][/h3]
        When close to terrain, a hovering algorithm tries preventing ground collisions!
    [*] [h3][b]Automatic Dismount Brake![/b][/h3]
        When you dismount the thruster, it immediately comes to a stop, preventing it from flying away without you!
    [*] [h3][b]Advanced Acceleration Control![/b][/h3]
        You can choose between constant-force and smart acceleration, and adjust acceleration parameters!
[/list]

[h1][b] Controls [/b][/h1]
These controls are also mentioned in-game.
[list]
    [*] [b][W][/b]: Fly Up
    [*] [b][A][/b]: Turn Left
    [*] [b][S][/b]: Fly Down
    [*] [b][D][/b]: Turn Right
    [*] [b] To stop, just hop off! [/b]
[/list]

[b] Special thanks to several people in the Guild Discord server for helping me figure out the logic for the physics-based controls![/b]

[b] Update 1: Added a second, Racing Thruster (maximum power by default) [/b]
[b] Update 2: Huge multiplayer controls improvements [/b]
7c5ae4d6-a818-49fc-9240-dca677c59368.name: Thrust-R Ridable Thruster

c7cc5332-59d0-479f-9870-8238cdfebf91.description:
Этот мод добавляет блок контроллера – универсальный компонент для управления подшипниками и двигателями, предназначенный для транспорта и авиации. Он позволяет точно задавать целевые углы вращения подшипников на основе различных входных сигналов.

Основные возможности
✅ Настраиваемые входы – Реакция на Газ, Руль, Тангаж, Крен, Логические сигналы, Угол атаки, Угол заноса, Угловые скорости (Тангаж, Крен, Рыскание), Скорость и произвольные комбинации.
✅ Кастомизация входных сигналов – Индивидуальный коэффициент масштабирования для точной настройки.
✅ Ограничения диапазона – Ограничение вращения подшипников для предотвращения чрезмерного поворота.
✅ Контроль скорости и импульса – Регулируемая отзывчивость и сила воздействия.
✅ Факторы давления и скорости – Эффекты демпфирования на основе скорости или имитации воздушного давления.
✅ Пресеты – Быстрая настройка для разных видов транспорта.
✅ Отображение на HUD (Переключаемое) – Показывает в реальном времени данные о транспорте (скорость, высота, углы, скорости вращения) при активном использовании.
✅ Поддержка мультиплеера – Синхронизация углов подшипников между игроками для реалистичного взаимодействия.

Как это работает
1️⃣ Размещение – Установите контроллер на своё транспортное средство.
2️⃣ Подключения – Соедините подшипники с выходными разъёмами.
3️⃣ Входные сигналы – Подключите сиденья водителя или логические устройства.
4️⃣ Настройка – Определите поведение входных сигналов в меню конфигурации.
5️⃣ Вождение – Садитесь за руль и наслаждайтесь полным контролем.

Применение
🚀 Управление аэродинамическими поверхностями (элероны, рули высоты, рули направления, элевоны, канарды)
🚗 Рулевое управление наземного транспорта
🤖 Контроль сочленений роботов
⚙️ Сложные механизмы, требующие точного углового управления
c7cc5332-59d0-479f-9870-8238cdfebf91.name: Falco controllers

0606ca9f-9c8c-49ff-8c86-40dbefce5dc2.description:
Get ready for an action-packed Tower Defense experience! Your mission: protect the radio antenna from waves of dangerous robots.

🔧 Daytime: Collect resources, build defenses, and upgrade your base. Farming and crafting are faster and easier, so you can focus on building strong defenses.
⚔️ Nighttime: Fight against fast, aggressive, and powerful robots that will try to break through and destroy everything in their way. Spoiler : They are stronger than vanilla.

If the antenna is destroyed, you lose the battle, and the day starts again before the attack, giving you a chance to improve your defenses. The difficulty adjusts based on the number of players, making every game a real challenge.

Move faster, build quicker, and fight harder—can you survive the invasion?

==========================================
Known issues :
 - The GUI of the shop is wrong and don't show your ressources, however it work well if you click on the button to buy

==========================================

I made this mod will learning how to make custom game, this is only a side project while developping the main mod : Space Scrapper (wich is absolutely not related).
Also I am not sure to maintain this mod too long. I'll do minimum maintenance to keep it on board, but I will not add too much new features.

That's said, I wish you to have fun !

PS : Be aware, this mod is hard, keep going harder with time, and get harder when you invite friend. Have fun !
0606ca9f-9c8c-49ff-8c86-40dbefce5dc2.name: Robot Invasion

9d0e9d15-0933-4697-9013-333cfba8c028.description:
Template Mod for 'ScrapMechanicModLoader'

Getting Started:

Step 1:
Navigate to: Steam/steamapps/workshop/content/387990/<id>/
You can copy this directory to any location; this serves as the example mod directory.

Step 2:
Open the mod.content file and set the following details:
- Title: Required
- Description: Optional
- Author: Optional
- Date: Optional
- Version: Required
- GameVersion: Required

After making these changes, save and close the file.

Step 3:
Once you've edited the mod file, you can add your custom files to the ModFiles folder (this folder will be copied to the game files).

Remember to also include the original, unmodified files in the Uninstall folder. These should be the untouched versions of the files you've altered.

Step 4:
Upload the mod to the Workshop (Optional)
If you choose to upload your SMML-compatible mod to the Workshop, make sure to include [SMML] in the mod’s name or add 'Tags: [SMML]' as the first line in the description.
You can also share the mod on Github or any other file-sharing service!

Step 5:
Happy modding!

7b5bbb31-320a-47ff-acfd-11fe96095a7d.description:
[h1]Customizable Survival Game Mode [/h1]
• This custom game mode adds a settings menu for the host to change some values about the Survival Game

[h2]Installation:[/h2]
• Subscribe , And Create a new Custom Game mode World using this "Mod" 

[h2]How to use it:[/h2]
• Just press R (Default) or your "Reload Button" To Bring up the ST Menu 
• Press "Apply Settings" when you are done changing
• Reload the World For the changes to take effect (You Should Get A Warning In Game When Needed)

[h2]Notes:[/h2]
• This mod doesn't add any content



[h1]Current Available Settings : [/h1]
[b]Stack Size Multiplier :[/b] Lets you change the sizes of resources and harvestables (Doesn't change all items).

[b]Resource Yield Multiplier :[/b] Lets you change how much resources are dropped / collected.

[b]Refining Yield Multiplier :[/b] Changes the quantity of earned blocks when refining (with both hand and refine bot).

[b]Refinery Bonus Multiplier :[/b] This multiplier is a percentage of how much extra blocks the refinery outputs .

[b]Add Custom Recipes :[/b] This allows you to activate/deactivate these custom recipes down below :
• Recipe to craft Component Kits Recipe.
• Recipe to craft Circuit Boards Recipe.
• Recipe to craft Circuit Boards using totebot Head.
• Recipe to craft Plastic Blocks.

[b]Use Minimal Crafting Time :[/b] Sets All Recipes Crafting timer to 3 seconds (the minimum in scrap mechanic)

[h2]Extra Changes :[/h2]
• Faster Hand Refining time.

[h3]Enjoy![/h3]
7b5bbb31-320a-47ff-acfd-11fe96095a7d.name: Survival Tweaks 2 - Customizable GM

e5024e0f-a97c-4b80-bcb4-42bb3cc8cc1d.description:
This mod makes hand refining faster! The default rate of refining is double that of vanilla.

The refining speed can be adjusted by typing [b][i]"/refinespeed <value in seconds>"[/i][/b] in chat and giving it a custom value. If you dont give any value, it will reset the refining speed to the mod's default which is twice that of vanilla

[h1]Note: This mod will work for both [u]Survival games[/u] and [u]Survival Custom games[/u].[/h1]

[h1]Installation: [/h1]
     [h2][u]1. Survival Games: (Needs to be installed manually) [/u][/h2]
     1. Subscribe to this mod
     2. Navigate to [i]'SteamLibrary/steamapps/workshop/content/387990/3444334449'[/i]
     3. Open the folder named [i]"COPY THE CONTENT INSIDE THIS FOLDER"[/i] and copy the contents inside it.
     4. Navigate to your game's local files, [i]'SteamLibrary/steamapps/common/Scrap Mechanic'[/i] and paste the copied contents inside and make sure to replace the existing files.
     5. Go to your Survival game and play!


     [h2][u]2. Survival Custom Games: (Does not require manual installation)[/u][/h2]
     Just go to your Survival Custom Game and enable the mod from the mod browser and play!

[hr][/hr]

To use this mod, i recommend a survival custom game such as [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2816900681]Modded Craftbot Recipes[/url]
e5024e0f-a97c-4b80-bcb4-42bb3cc8cc1d.name: Faster Refining Speed

597a09af-7ff2-4f87-96cd-3039df2c5d73.description:
This addon adds new functions to the Computer API and modifies some components.

[h1]=================== Computer API ====================[/h1]

[h2] global / sc [/h2]
[list]
    [*] [b]sc.isExtended()[/b] – Returning [b]true[/b] if extended, [b]nil[/b] if not.
    [*] [b]debugf( format, ... )[/b] – Logs messages in the console with different severity levels ('error', 'info', 'warning').
[/list]

[h2] os [/h2]
[list]
    [*] [b]os.date( format, timestamp )[/b] – Returns formatted date/time based on the given format and timestamp.
    [*] [b]os.exit( code )[/b] – Terminates the program execution. If a code is provided, it will be returned as the exit status, with 0 typically indicating successful completion and non-zero values indicating errors.
[/list]

[h2] math [/h2]
[list]
    [*] [b]math.sign( x )[/b] – Returns [b]1[/b] if positive, [b]-1[/b] if negative, or [b]0[/b].
    [*] [b]math.round( number, digits )[/b] – Rounds a number to the given number of decimal places.
    [*] [b]math.tointeger( x )[/b] – Converts a number to an integer if possible; returns nil if the conversion is not possible.
    [*] [b]math.type( x )[/b] – Returns [b]"integer"[/b] for whole numbers and [b]"float"[/b] for decimals.
    [*] [b]math.ult( m, n )[/b] – Returns the unsigned integer less-than comparison of two numbers [b]m[/b] and [b]n[/b], effectively checking if [b]m[/b] is less than [b]n[/b] in an unsigned context (without considering negative numbers).
    [*] [b]math.isnan( x )[/b] – Checks if the value [b]x[/b] is [b]nan[/b] (Not a Number).
    [*] [b]math.maxinteger[/b] – Returns maximum integer that can be represented in Lua.
    [*] [b]math.mininteger[/b] – Returns minimum integer that can be represented in Lua.
    [*] [b]math.nan[/b] – Returns [b]nan[/b].
[/list]

[h2] sm [/h2]
[list]
    [*] sm.shape.getShapeDescription( uuid )
    [*] sm.shape.getShapeTitle( uuid )
    [*] sm.projectile.getProjectileMass( uuid )
    [*] sm.item.isBlock( uuid )
    [*] sm.item.isJoint( uuid )
    [*] sm.item.isPart( uuid )
    [*] sm.item.isTool( uuid )
    [*] sm.game.getServerTick()
    [*] sm.game.getTimeOfDay()
[/list]

[h1]================ Component Changes =================[/h1]

[h2] GravityController [/h2]
[list]
    [*] [b]GravityController.applyImpulse( impulse, worldSpace, offset )[/b] – Applies an impulse to the object.
    [*] [b]GravityController.applyTorque( torque, worldSpace )[/b] – Applies torque to the object.
    [*] [b]GravityController.getWorldGravity()[/b] – Returns the current world gravity.
[/list]

[h2] Motor [/h2]
[list]
    [*] [b]Motor.getCurrentLength()[/b] – Returns the current piston length (only one piston can be connected).
    [*] [b]Motor.getBearingsData()[/b] – Returns bearings data (angle, angularVelocity, appliedImpulse, isReversed).
    [*] [b]Motor.getPistonsData()[/b] – Returns pistons data (length).
[/list]

[h2] Radar [/h2]
[list]
    [*] The max radar scan angles has been increased from 90 to 180 degrees.
[/list]

Feel free to share your ideas and suggestions in the comments!
597a09af-7ff2-4f87-96cd-3039df2c5d73.name: ScrapComputers Extended

d5f7e1ba-70f8-448a-9bcf-cef6bf523437.description:
[h1]Lets you instantly warp a creation to a new location![/h1]

This mod does not add new parts to the game, but adds new functionalities to existing seats, saddles, and the driver variants.

Please watch the video for usage instructions.

Enter [i]/quickwarp[/i] into the in-game chat to configure the controls and options for the mod.

The mod does not work on pre-survival seat variants, office chair, bathtub, or toilet.
Install and enable the optional [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3452511878]Scripted Non-Scripted Seats[/url] mod if you want those seats to also have the QuickWarp functionality.

23cd6e89-f0f4-4121-988a-e0208f343a21.description:
this addon for SComputers adds a computer running on the brainf*ck programming language!

the "." operator outputs values to the bf_output register and to the logPrint.
the "," operator takes values from the bf_input register, if there is none, then from the first input connected to the computer.

a computer can execute up to 100000 brainf*ck instructions in one tick.
to complete the execution in this tick, use the "," operator while reading input, the computer does nothing else and waits for the next tick.

to interact with the rest of the peripheral, use lua-invoke. to do this, output the lua-invoke as a string in "." it should start with byte 1 and end with byte 0.
there is a special python script in the mod files for automatic lua-invoke generation: Scripts/examples/luaInvokeGenerator.py
for luaInvokeGenerator.py to work, when calling lua-invoke, the selected memory location must have a value of 0. after completing lua-invoke, 0 will remain in this cell.
lua-invoke gets the brainf*ck memory table as the first argument, which is indexed from 0.
this allows data exchange between lua and brainf*ck.
please do not write anything there except integers from 0 to 255, as this will lead to UB

if you run a ready-made program on brainf*ck, it will output its result to the computer console and chat.
and accept input from the bf_input register, or if there is none, then from the first connected input.
if you do not need output to the chat,
then you can implement your output function using lua-invoke or disable output to the chat in the mod's Permission Tool
(in this case, output will continue to bf_output and to the computer console)
23cd6e89-f0f4-4121-988a-e0208f343a21.name: brainf_ck language [SComputers addon]

7a7cf469-37b4-4ea5-bbca-771e2c46258a.description:
[h2]No more guessing what mods a blueprint might use![/h2]
A ~95% accurate mod finder, that finds just about any mod that any blueprint uses!

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Important![/h1]
[list]
[*]This is [b]NOT[/b] a file mod!
[*]This mod will [b]NEVER[/b] be 100% accurate and may include mods that don't exist in some cases (due to ModDatabase not clearning those up)
[*]Instructions to get the localId of a blueprint are present in the Help menu accessible from the main gui via the button next to the Check button.
[*]To open the menu, use the "/findModsForBlueprint" command.
[*][b]Report any issues in the comments (like if you find some non-existing mods, in which case include the download link to that mod in your report)[/b]
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Features[/h1]
[list]
[*]Finds almost all the required mods for a blueprint with ~95% accuracy.
[*]Button to get the mod download link and export all required mods.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Support:[/h2]
[*]Rate, Favorite, Share and Award!
[img]https://fagiano0.github.io/CrashlanderAPI/images/workshop/ratefavourite.gif[/img]
7a7cf469-37b4-4ea5-bbca-771e2c46258a.name: Blueprint Mods Finder

50c496e8-57e2-469f-b18e-ac062c51e75b.description:
[h1] Most of the code and assets in this mod are not mine. [/h1]

[h1] GO INSTALL THE MAIN MOD ITS REALLY GOOD [/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2936300656

[h1]ALSO DO NOT ENABLE THIS MOD AND ROBOTIZATION AT THE SAME TIME!![/h1]
(Creations made with robotization should work with this one.)

I made this mod because there was some stuff i thought that would be really nice to have in robotization like intelligentias player imitator (especially for missiles), However i had to copy all of the assets over because first i have no idea how overriding files if it is even possible in scrap mechanic as i had to override some code in the main lua file. And second i have no idea how to extend off of a mod in the first place. 
If the original owner of robotization wants me to take this mod down or incorporate it into their mod thats fine.

[h2] Additions: [/h2]

Takes logic signal then outputs fake player location to any "Search Players" block.

[b]Search Creations w Height[/b]:

Is search creations but you can provide a height value with number logic and it will only track creations above that height relative to the main creation. (Basically for anti air)

01816d7d-d2c6-4b3d-b13b-c32a723e495c.description:
[h2]Auditory expansion for the Crashlander Custom Game![/h2]
Wolves finally sound like Wolves, caves are scarier and all new OST! Experience a fully scripted and programmed radio with cameos, jokes and in-lore information!

[hr][/hr]
[img]https://redoingmods.github.io/img/logos/Crashlander_AE_Logo.png[/img]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Important![/h1]
[list]
[*]This is [b]NOT[/b] a file mod!
[*]This mod [b]ONLY WORKS[/b] with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3113900342]Crashlander [/url](version 1.2.0.6+) and [url=https://github.com/QuestionableM/SM-CustomAudioExtension]Custom Audio Extension DLL mod[/url]
[*]To disable music, do "/setmusicstate false"
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Features:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Biome & area specific music, delicately picked songs from popular games such as Subnautica and Satisfactory even including custom tracks in collaboration with the ChargingTurnip!
[*]Ovehauled radio with many more songs, lore friendly cameos, custom ads and even more! Be sure to check that one out!
[*]Voice Acting for NPC's and the radio! (Voiced by Uriah, MrMonkeySam, mijetboi and Taurieth)
[*]Custom animal & environmental sounds.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Installation[/h1]
1. Download this mod

2. Download and install the scrap mechanic DLL injector
2.1 https://github.com/QuestionableM/SM-DLL-Injector/releases/latest
2.2 Click on "DLL-Injector-Installer.exe", this will download the exe
2.3 Run the exe and install the injector

3. Download and install the scrap mechanic custom audio extension
3.1 https://github.com/QuestionableM/SM-CustomAudioExtension/releases/latest
3.2 Click on "CustomAudioExtension.dll", this will download the dll
3.3 Go to your steam library
3.4 Right click Scrap Mechanic in the list
3.5 Hover over "Manage"
3.6 Click "View local files"
3.7 Go into the "Release" folder
3.8 Right click and create a NEW folder called "DLLModules"
3.9 Move the previously downloaded "CustomAudioExtension.dll" into the newly created folder
3.10 Close the file explorer

4. Start up Scrap Mechanic and enable the mod on your Crashlander save

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Links:[/h2]
[url=https://discord.com/invite/PXzDWcM6uZ]Discord Server[/url]

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Support:[/h2]
[*]Rate, Favorite, Share and Award!
[img]https://fagiano0.github.io/CrashlanderAPI/images/workshop/ratefavourite.gif[/img]
01816d7d-d2c6-4b3d-b13b-c32a723e495c.name: Crashlander Audio Enhancement

d810c62f-ff0c-44f9-9168-a3f27475c81a.description:
This Mod Is Unofficial And Contains Code From ScrapNautica By 0x55 .
Original ScrapNautica Link: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2808140550

This Mod Adds Dev Commands To ScrapNautica

Commands (From The Scrap Mechanic Fandom)
Ammo	/ammo [(int)quantity]	Give ammo (default 50)	
Spudgun	/spudgun	Give the spudgun	
Gatling	/gatling	Give the potato gatling gun	
Shotgun	/shotgun	Give the fries shotgun	
Sunshake	/sunshake	Give 1 sunshake	
Baguette	/baguette	Give 1 revival baguette	
Keycard	/keycard	Give 1 keycard	
Powercore	/powercore	Give 1 powercore	
Components	/components [(int)quantity]	Give <quantity> components (default 10)	
Glowsticks	/glowsticks [(int)quantity]	Give <quantity> components (default 10)	Description is incorrect.
Gives the specified amount of Glowsticks.
Tumble	/tumble [(bool)enable]	Set tumble state	Puts the Mechanic into a ragdoll state.
God	/god	Mechanic characters will take no damage	Toggles godmode.
Respawn	/respawn	Respawn at last bed (or at the crash site)	
Encrypt	/encrypt	Restrict interactions in all warehouses	Enables the ability to remove globally restricted objects.
Enables Encryptor interactions.
Decrypt	/decrypt	Unrestrict interactions in all warehouses	Removes the ability to remove globally restricted objects.
Disables Encryptor interactions.
Limited	/limited	Use the limited inventory	Enables the standard Survival Mode inventory.
Unlimited	/unlimited	Use the unlimited inventory	Enables an inventory similar to Creative Mode inventory, but with all Survival Mode items and objects available.
Ambush	/ambush [(number)magnitude] [(int)wave]	Starts a 'random' encounter	An unused event where the Mechanic would be randomly attacked by a group of Robots in Survival Mode, similar to raids.
Time of Day	/timeofday [(number)timeOfDay]	Sets the time of the day as a fraction (0.5=mid day)	
Time Progress	/timeprogress [(bool)enabled]	Enables or disables time progress	
Day	/day	Disable time progression and set time to daytime	
Spawn	/spawn [(string)unitName]	Spawn a unit: 'woc',

1b565caa-b4b8-427c-90db-e82275c5228f.description:
It's time to update your Blender!

Blender 4.4.2 addresses 8 issues present in the initial release.

This is a corrective release, meaning it doesn't contain new features, only fixes. It is highly recommended for everyone currently using Blender 4.4.1 to upgrade, since it fixes several crashes and improves functionality in many areas.

Read the full list of changes on https://developer.blender.org/docs/release_notes/4.4/corrective_releases/
Follow Blender on X for further updates. https://x.com/Blender
The Blender team,
29th April 2025
1b565caa-b4b8-427c-90db-e82275c5228f.name: WhatsAppVideo2025-05-12at20.4857

0f8af637-5772-4f06-acc3-712d1042cbcb.description:
Raw Wilderness is a truly randomly generating near tileless worlds. There are no structures as beacons, no roads to guide you on, and no warehouses to raid. At least you can enjoy nature here.

* The logbook has been replaced with the personal crafting system. 
* The Hideout Trader is replaced with Trader Bots. Spud guns are easy to get, by the way. The packing station doesn't exist, so crates are replaced by their golden variant of fruit or veggie. Warehouse Keycards are useful here.

Raw wilderness has a natural spawning system. Every night, those evil bots will spawn, with the surface being the safest. Every day, you can catch a break for the entire duration. There's a 25% spawn rate increase per non-host player in the game

Crates are common here, but smash them with delicacy, because they won't respawn, ever! The green crates are guaranteed to drop a fruit or veggie.

Farming will be way less riskier, so you can no longer have to worry about those pesky raiders. It may be best to stay far away from your farming spot at night, though.

[b]Commands:[/b]
Anything that starts with "/h_" are Host only commands:
[list]
[*]/h_cheats <boolean> - Enable or disable cheats, Once enabled, players that joins will be warned that cheats are on. It would warn all players if cheats are on record when joined.
[*]/h_dev - Enable Cheats, your godmode, and creative inventory
[*]/h_mp_pvp <boolean> - Enable or Disable PvP. While enabled, it hides all enemy nametags.
[*]/h_mp_teams_max <integer> - You can have 0 teams, basically FFA at this point, or 1 team, up to 4 teams
[*]/h_mp_team_change <boolean> - Enable or Disable team changing.
[*]/h_mp_teams_shuffle - Shuffling should set ALL players in random teams, and will even the teams.
[*]/h_mp_friendly_fire <boolean> - Enable or Disable friendly fire against teammates while PvP is on.
[*]/h_pdb_list <integer:page> - list all players in the player database (wrong description in game).
[*]/h_pdb_ban <player>, <boolean>  - Set someone banned (will fix), once banned, they cannot be unbanned until cheats are in record.
[*]/h_pdb_operator <player>, <boolean>  - Set someone as an operator
[*]/h_pdb_inspect <iplayer> - inspects a player's inventory. In a legit world, you cannot take anything out of their inventory until cheats are on or banned by you.
[/list]
Anything with "/c_" are Cheat commands once cheats are enabled:
[list]
[*]/c_god <boolean> - Enable or Disable YOUR god mode
[*]/c_gamerule <name>, <boolean> Enable or Disable a game rule.
[/list]
Other commands:
[list]
[*]/mp_teams <integer> - You can change teams there in a few conditions; that Teams are enabled and team changing are allowed.
[/list]
0f8af637-5772-4f06-acc3-712d1042cbcb.name: Raw Wilderness
